title: Zoo animals in the wild: beavers
creator_credit: Coronet Films, Bill Walker and Mel Waskin
brief_description: Notes the eating habits of the beaver and shows how it constructs a dam using its sharp front teeth to gnaw away branches, and its rudder-shaped tail and webbed back paws to gather mud to cement the branches together. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
creator_credit_for_label: Coronet Films, Bill Walker and Mel Waskin
